text:
Is there a way to round all numbers printed using `println` without using `round()`. I have quite a few `println` functions that output some data, but it's quite messy for example
```    (lo R) inc mean: 1.0830098189359761e6 (CrI: 937167.4969324856 - 1.22668829309364e6)```
I would like to automatically just round these to the nearest whole digit (but not through out the script, only for that function).  And even more particular, only round inside the `println` the data that is interpolated. I would really hate to have `round` statements everywhere
